pullRequest.title: Prefix tag names with `release-`
pullRequest.bodyText:
This allows being more selective on which tags to create releases on.
For example tags like docs-v1.2.3 will not trigger a release.
Authored-by: Oliver Albertini oalbertini@vmware.com

nodes.bodyText: maybe create a PREFIX variable here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -77,9 +77,9 @@ git -C pxf_src remote set-url origin "${GIT_REMOTE_URL}"
 # avoid detached HEAD state from Concourse checking out a SHA
 git -C pxf_src checkout "${GIT_BRANCH}"
 
-echo "Creating new tag ${pxf_version}..."
+echo "Creating new tag v${pxf_version}..."

nodes.bodyText: can we use release- instead of v?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -77,9 +77,9 @@ git -C pxf_src remote set-url origin "${GIT_REMOTE_URL}"
 # avoid detached HEAD state from Concourse checking out a SHA
 git -C pxf_src checkout "${GIT_BRANCH}"
 
-echo "Creating new tag ${pxf_version}..."
+echo "Creating new tag v${pxf_version}..."
 # create annotated tag
-git -C pxf_src tag -am "PXF Version ${pxf_version}" "${pxf_version}"
+git -C pxf_src tag -am "PXF Version v${pxf_version}" "v${pxf_version}"

beforeCommit.message:
Prefix tag names with 'v'

This allows being more selective on which tags to create releases on.
For example tags like docs-v1.2.3 will not trigger a release.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

commit.message:

This allows being more selective on which tags to create releases on.
For example tags like docs-1.2.3 will not trigger a release.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>
